question:
A company has $50 office supplies at the beginning of the year. 
During the year, the company purchased $500 of office supplies on credit. 
On December 31, there is $100 of office supplies remained. 
What are the adjusting entries for office supplies expense?

answers.text:
Debit Depreciation expense - Supplies $450
Credit Accumulated Depreciation - Supplies $450

Debit Depreciation expense - Supplies $450
Credit Supplies $450

Debit Depreciation expense - Supplies $400
Credit Supplies $400

question: On April 1, 2009, a company prepaid $1,350 on a three-year insurance. What will be the insurance expense on the income statement for the year ended December 31, 2009?

Prepare the necessary closing entries:
Asset : $15,000
Liability: $14,000
Withdrawal: $2,000

The J. Chow, Capital account has a credit balance of $17,000. If total revenues for the period are $55,200, total expenses are $39,800, and withdrawals are $9,000, what is the ending balance in the J. Chow, Capital account?

Prepare the necessary entries to close revenue, knowing the following ending balances:
Asset : $10,000
Revenue: $ 15,000
Unearned revenue: $1,000

answers.text:
Debit Unearned Revenue: $1,000
Credit Income summary: $1,000

Debit Revenue: $15,000
Debit Unearned Revenue: $1,000
Credit Income summary: $16,000

Debit Income summary: $1,000
Credit Unearned Revenue: $1,000

question:
Provide descriptions for this transaction:
Debit Cash $2,000 and Credit Accounts Receivable $2,000

answers.text: Received cash for an account receivable

question:
Provide descriptions for this transaction:
Debit Rent expense $8,000 and credit Prepaid rent $8,000

answers.text: Adjusting prepaid rent at the end of period $8,000

question: If the owner of a restaurant, uses cash of the business to pay for renting his house, the business should record this use of cash with an entry to:
Invested $10,000 cash, and a car worth $25,000. Prepare journal entries to record the transactions:

answers.text:
Debit Cash $10,000
Credit Capital $10,000

Debit Car $25,000
Credit Cash $25,000

Debit Cash $10,000
Debit Car $25,000
Credit Capital $35,000

question:
A company completed these transactions:
1. Open new restaurant, by investing $30,000 cash and equipment valued at $10,000.
2. Purchased $1,000 of kitchen utility on credit.
3. Paid $1,500 cash for the staff's salary.
4. Served meals to customers and collected $4,000 cash
What was the balance of the cash account after these transactions were posted?

On Dec. 01 the Company purchased an equipment for use that costs $10,000 with estimated useful life of 5 year and salvage value of $400. Calculate the depreciation expense for December 31 (the month ended) and prepare the journal entry to record that expense.

answers.text:
Debit Depreciation expense $160
Credit Accumulated Depreciation $160

Debit Depreciation expense $400
Credit Accumulated Depreciation $400

question: During the current year ended December 31, clients paid fees in advance for accounting services amounting to $10,000. If $2,500 of these fees remains unearned on December 31 of this year, present the December 31 adjusting entry to bring the accounts up to date.

The company has incurred (but not recorded) property tax expense of $2,000 for the year ended December 31. The company must pay the interest on January 2 of the following year. Prepare the adjusting entries to record this.

answers.text:
Debit Property tax expense $2,000 
Credit Cash $2,000

Debit Property tax expense $2,000 
Credit Property tax payable $2,000

Debit Interest expense $2,000 
Credit Interest payable $2,000

question: What is the journal entry to record purchase of supplies on credit?

answers.text:
Debit Supplies expense
Credit Supplies payable

question: Taos Company paid $100 cash for shipping cost of merchandise purchased on terms FOB shipping point. This is recorded as:

answers.text: Debit Merchandise Inventory; Credit Accounts Payable
Debit Shipping expense; Credit Accounts Payable

question:
You have the following information:
Purchased merchandise for $50,000 on credit, credit terms 2/10 n/30
Paid $250 on the shipping cost.
Paid the invoice within the discount period.
What is the total cost of merchandise purchased?
Under credit terms 3/15, n/45, the discount period and discount are
After a year, you have $20,000 of merchandise inventory remained. This value of merchandise inventory is:

You sell merchandise on account for $2,000 with credit terms of 2/10, n/30. 
The customer pays within discount period.
What is the journal entry to record cash collection?

answers.text:
Dr. Cash                $1,960
Dr. Sales Discount      $40
   Cr. Accounts Receivable       $2,000

Dr. Cash $1,960
   Dr. Sales Returns and Allowances $40
   Cr. Accounts Receivable          $2,000

Dr. Cash $1,960
   Cr. Sales Discount      $40
   Cr. Accounts Receivable $1,960

question: Journal entries to record the purchase of merchandise inventory on cash is:

answers.text: Debit Accounts payable; Credit Merchandise Inventory
Debit Merchandise Inventory; Credit Accounts payable

question: On July 12, $800 of merchandise are purchased with credit terms of 1/10, n/30. How much would the buyer pay on July 20?
After purchasing $2,000 merchandise on credit (recorded to Accounts payable), the company found defective merchandise of $500 and decided to return. The return of merchandise is recorded as:

answers.text: Debit Accounts payable $500; Credit Merchandise Inventory $500
Debit Accounts payable $1500; Credit Merchandise Inventory $1500

question:
Beginning inventory:	10 units @ $10 per unit	
First purchase:	        35 units @ $11 per unit	
Sale:		30 units
Second purchase:	        10 units @ $12 per unit	
The value of the ending inventory using LIFO valuation method is:

Beginning inventory:	15 units @ $10 per unit
First purchase:	35 units @ $11 per unit
Sale:	20 units @ $12 per unit
Using FIFO method, prepare the journal entry to record the cost of goods sold for the above sales transaction:

answers.text: Dr. $205 to Cost of goods sold, Cr. $205 to Merchandise Inventory
Dr. $220 to Cost of goods sold, Cr. $220 to Merchandise Inventory
Dr. $205 to Merchandise Inventory, Cr. $205 to Cost of goods sold
Dr. $220 to Merchandise Inventory, Cr. $220 to Cost of goods sold

question:
Beginning inventory:	75 units @ $25
1st Purchase:	348 units @ $27 each	
1st sales:		300 units
2nd Purchase:	257 units @ $28 each	
2nd Sales:		275
Using FIFO method, determine value of ending inventory after all transactions above.

Beginning: 50 units @ $50
1st purchase: 200 units @ $55
Sale: 210 units @ $85
Compute the cost of goods sold using weighted average method.

The collection of a $900 account receivable with 2 percent discount will result in a:
(You have to choose 2 answers)

Beginning inventory:	100 units @ $10	
Purchase:	150 units @ $12	
1st Sales:		180 units @ $40
Purchase	100 units @ $14	
2nd Sales:		150 units @ $40
Using LIFO method, determine the cost of goods sold for the 2nd sales.
